title: Synthetic Recap
body:
WASHINGTON – In the record books, it will be a 97-86 victory for the Washington Bullets over the Atlanta Hawks. In the annals of the game, it will be remembered as the night Gheorghe Muresan authored a performance of pure, dominant force.

The seven-foot-seven center from Romania was simply unstoppable, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 47 points against a helpless Atlanta frontcourt. Muresan didn’t just score; he imposed his will, shooting a blistering 20-of-27 from the field. Every entry pass became an imminent two points, as he used his immense frame to establish position and his soft touch to finish with ruthless efficiency.

While Muresan was the undeniable engine of the offense, he was far from a one-man show. Point guard Rod Strickland orchestrated the attack with a masterful 18-assist performance, feeding the hot hand of Muresan time and again while also chipping in 14 points of his own. The Hawks, led by 23 points from Steve Smith, simply had no answer for the Bullets' inside-out assault.

This was more than a win; it was a historic event. Muresan’s 47 points were a testament to a unique talent operating at his absolute peak. On this night, the Capital Centre witnessed a giant not just play the game, but transcend it, delivering a performance for the ages that propelled Washington to a decisive victory.
